article_title: Traton, Navistar Said to Hold Last-Ditch Talks to Save Deal
article_text: LISTEN TO ARTICLE    1:32      SHARE THIS ARTICLE   Share   Tweet   Post   Email  {"contentId":"QIAFJ9DWLU6G01","position":"brokerboxarticle","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[120,60]],"small_desktop":[[120,60]],"tablet":[[120,60]]},"strategy":"viewable","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"brokerboxarticle1","url":"/news/articles/2020-10-16/traton-navistar-said-to-hold-last-minute-talks-to-salvage-deal"},"containerId":"brokerboxarticle-zoblkBt"}       A Traton International LT A26 haulage truck.  Photographer: Krisztian Bocsi/Bloomberg    Photographer: Krisztian Bocsi/Bloomberg   Traton SE, the heavy-truck unit owned by Volkswagen AG, is holding last-minute talks with Navistar International Corp. to try and salvage a takeover deal ahead of a Friday deadline, according to people familiar with the matter.    The boards are discussing whether they can reach a compromise on price or extend the deadline for the proposed $3.6 billion deal, said the people, who asked not to be identified because talks are private. The last-ditch negotiations may not lead to any agreement, the people said.    {"contentId":"QIAFJ9DWLU6G01","position":"outstream","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[1,8]],"small_desktop":[[1,8]],"tablet":[[1,8]]},"strategy":"always","type":"Outstream Video Native Ad","targeting":{"position":"outstream","url":"/news/articles/2020-10-16/traton-navistar-said-to-hold-last-minute-talks-to-salvage-deal"},"containerId":"outstream-video-1-QIAFJ9DWLU6G01"}   {"contentId":"QIAFJ9DWLU6G01","position":"outstream","dimensions":{"mobile":[[1,8]]},"strategy":"always","type":"Outstream Video Native Ad","targeting":{"position":"outstream","url":"/news/articles/2020-10-16/traton-navistar-said-to-hold-last-minute-talks-to-salvage-deal"},"containerId":"outstream-video-2-QIAFJ9DWLU6G01"}   A representative for Traton declined to comment. A representative for Navistar couldn’t be immediately reached for comment    {"contentId":"QIAFJ9DWLU6G01","position":"box","dimensions":{"mobile":[[300,250],[3,3],[1,1],"fluid"]},"type":"Mobile Body Box Ad","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"box1","positionIncrement":1,"url":"/news/articles/2020-10-16/traton-navistar-said-to-hold-last-minute-talks-to-salvage-deal"},"containerId":"box-tjfbi7u"}   Traton put out a surprise statement on Oct. 14 saying that its $43-a-share “best and final” offer expires at 6 p.m. Central European Time today and will be withdrawn unless it’s notified of a willingness to proceed.    Navistar shares plunged as much as 21% to $35 after the announcement, matching Traton’s initial offer made in January. The stock rose as much as 16% before the start of regular trading in New York on Friday.  {"contentId":"QIAFJ9DWLU6G01","position":"desktop-in-article1","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[5,4]],"small_desktop":[[5,4]]},"type":"Desktop in article Native Ad","targeting":{"position":"desktop-in-article1","url":"/news/articles/2020-10-16/traton-navistar-said-to-hold-last-minute-talks-to-salvage-deal"},"containerId":"desktop-in-article-1-QIAFJ9DWLU6G01"}   While U.S.-based Navistar signaled last month it would push for a higher bid and has been seeking an offer closer to $50 a share, Traton has so far stuck to its $43 a-share-offer, the people said.  Billionaire investor Carl Icahn is Navistar’s largest shareholder with a 16.8% stake, followed by VW with a 16.7% holding. Its third-largest shareholder is MHR Fund Management, the hedge fund founded by Mark Rachesky.  (Adds Navistar share move in fifth paragraph)   Published on ‎16‎ ‎October‎, ‎2020‎ ‎12‎:‎25  Updated on  ‎16‎ ‎October‎, ‎2020‎ ‎12‎:‎54        Have a confidential tip for our reporters?
